file_content.text: This is C-9X, the perfect marriage of Czerka's lethality and CEC's inspired engineering. Even controls nearby droids with a custom signal emitter.
How could you ignore my advice? I go to all that trouble, put my life on the line, and then you hurt my delicate feelings.
Business is war, gentlemen. And we've almost got the scum beat!
Uh... Master Maas... we have company.
You? That means C-9X... you destroyed him? Impossible!
This is your last chance--bow to Imperial rule, or die.
Give up already.
No one tells me when to retire. Droids--attack!
I bet you'll come apart much easier than that tank of yours.
You're next.
You're not laying a finger on me. Droids--attack!
Impossible for some, not me.
What are you waiting for, droids? Attack!
Benton... he has the C-9X signal emitter. Maybe we should do what he says.
Benton... she's got the C-9X signal emitter. Maybe we should follow the nice lady's orders.
Benton... they've got the C-9X signal emitter. Maybe we should just surrender.
Corellian Engineering Corp stands for something! This is our chance to do the same.
Go ahead. Turn our droids on us. If you enslave CEC, it won't be with our help.
You heard him, droids. Open fire.
Okay. [Order droids to kill]
Droids--take them to Commander Krade at the Imperial outpost.
We need you alive.
You'll learn that to serve the galaxy, you must serve the Empire.
If you don't cooperate, we'll break you.
Play nice, and you'll never see me again.
You may have won this fight, but the resistance won't fall so easily!
Now these droids will send the message that no one messes with CEC.
First you break into my company, then you barge in here without an appointment.
My droids will throw you out, piece by piece. Then Darth Charnus will realize CEC can't be taken.
The sooner you and Corellia recognize Imperial rule, the better.
Idealism will get you nowhere.
Delusions may shield your sanity, but they won't protect CEC.
That's crazy talk.
I've taken out a small army of CEC's finest. Why not a few more?
More droids? Bring them on.
I can't wait to shut you up.
Afraid I'm going to deny you that pleasure.
Combat tests were through the roof. Cost a fortune, but that's the price of freedom.
The dark side breaks one's chains, nothing else.
Only Sith can attain freedom.
How inclusive of you. No wonder Corellia's so eager to welcome the Sith.
Once the Empire's in control, we'll define liberty for you.
Freedom's a relative term.
Liberty doesn't exist when there's a price on your head.
You can't buy freedom now.
You should've just bought a ticket off Corellia.
Looks like a waste of credits.
This marvel's an investment in CEC's future. Nothing's more important.
I'll enjoy smashing your little toy.
Enough show and tell.
Come on, C-9X. Show your stuff.
Now that you're here, we can take on CEC's board and....
I think it's time my droids ruin you. And lucky me--I've got a front row seat.
Your droids--and CEC--will crumble under the dark side's might.
You underestimate my power.
It'll take more than Force tricks to dismantle good Corellian engineering.
If you knew my methods, you'd have sent your entire army after me.
An ambush won't stop me.
I'll call your bluff, raise you a squad of CEC's newest combat models.
I've met some repugnant frauds, but you're the slimiest one yet.
Two-faced scum!
What did you expect? No one lies better than a Corellian.
Traitors must be punished.
Don't know if you've noticed, but I've got you surrounded.
Droids, go to town.
